main event: The crew of a weather reconnaissance aircraft sighted a dark, fast-moving object approximately 12 feet in diameter over the Atlantic Ocean near Bermuda on December 17, 1957.
interesting points: The object was moving much faster than the aircraft and suddenly disappeared from view.
The reporter did not have an opportunity to take photographs of the object.
The sighting was investigated by the Office of the Deputy Chief of Staff, Plans at Headquarters USAF and information was disseminated on January 8, 1958.
The object was described as having a shiny, metallic appearance and glittering in the sun.
The observers, who were considered reliable, included a weather reconnaissance officer, pilot, navigator, and airborne weather operator.
sighted object: Dark, fast-moving object approximately 12 feet in diameter
location: Atlantic Ocean, east of Bermuda Island
witnesses: Crew of a weather reconnaissance aircraft
